titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Schulz family photographs V1982.001
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:14-0500

did.abstract: One photograph and one photographic postcard, circa 1905, of the Schulz family and house on Shore Road in the Bay Ridge neighborhood of Brooklyn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. All images in this collection will enter the public domain by 2025. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Schulz family photographs, V1982.001, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. William J. Schulz, 1982.

controlaccess.subject: Street photography |z New York (State) |z Kings County
